content:
Certainly! The Getty Museum has developed several mobile apps that visitors can use to enhance their experience at the museum. Here are some of the most popular apps:

1. GettyGuide: This app provides visitors with a self-guided audio tour of the museum's collections. The app includes information on over 7,000 artworks, as well as maps of the galleries and information on upcoming exhibitions.

2. Getty360: This app provides a 360-degree view of the museum's galleries, allowing visitors to explore the artworks and exhibitions from the comfort of their own homes. The app also includes audio commentary from curators and other experts.

3. Getty Augmented Reality: This app uses augmented reality technology to provide visitors with an interactive experience of the artworks. Visitors can use their smartphones or tablets to scan artworks and access additional information, such as videos and audio commentary.

4. Getty Images: This app provides access to the museum's extensive collection of high-quality photographic images. Visitors can search for images and save them to their personal collections for future reference.

Overall, the Getty Museum's mobile apps provide visitors with a wealth of information and interactive experiences that enhance their understanding and appreciation of the artworks on display.
